title: Grade 8
subject: Essential Elements for English Language Arts (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards Essential Elements for English Languange Arts

6D58C29382774EAA8E546BB2734EC863.description:
Use general academic and domain- specific
words and phrases across contexts.

0A2486CCCF16465E8D392812E08507BB.description:
Use descriptive words to add meaning when writing
and communicating

2E99688E5B9943BF985E08726FC3EF9E.description:
Use knowledge of common words to understand
the meaning of compound and complex words in
which they appear (e.g., birdhouse, household).

3946D819731B42F1B54A11911331D3C6.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the use of multiple
meaning words

FC698D366B6040A1BB270736A7A81038.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word relationships
and use.

F8739C0BB6B940E1912EF14550B324EC.description:
Seek clarification and meaning support when
unfamiliar words are encountered while reading or
communicating.

CECDA0EEBE944529AB5731F408F37689.description:
Use frequently occurring root words (e.g., like) and
the words that result when affixes are added (e.g.,
liked, disliked, liking).

00153DD6678445F1B7893FDDC0EBDEE5.description:
Use context to determine which word is missing
from a content area text.

AF0C34A91C2B4847A3DDA8A0ECA5CBCE.description:
Use to-be verbs (am, are, is, was, were, be,
become, became) accurately when writing and
communicating.

3E325937B45E45DB89218A88032A8ED8.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes when
communicating.

744DEB0DFE7945A895D42146A1651053.description:
Spell words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of
letter- sound relationships and/or common spelling
patterns.

AA5893EF93844B7AB6D73573C125E585.description:
Use end punctuation and capitalization when
writing a sentence or question.

C62FEE30ED964DEFBF1E659EAFAAF22A.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

F7ADBFB12CEB49098C4A54AFCFE7155B.description: Use appropriate verbs to match nouns.

1401EB6035D649A6AF2A96282932D0F2.description:
Form and use the simple verb tenses (e.g., I
walked, I walk, I will walk).

4B3E9F7D15B448EDA0BB578F77C087D7.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

E1A31E8A0B9E4EF3B804FDA247FACBC0.description:
Adapt communication to a variety of contexts
and tasks.

26B16B09BA8F4013B70ACD9002470DE0.description:
Include multimedia and visual information into
presentations.

7BCAA2A5835644E89B3ACBD2C1B706D0.description:
Present descriptions, facts, or details supporting
specific points made on a topic.

29690E8C340444808505F3E2A52B758C.description:
Determine the argument made by a speaker on
a topic.

1375344FE02A40C7AD62C77AD26563CD.description:
Determine the purpose of information
presented in graphic, oral, visual, or multimodal formats.

09F709C8EA5B4508A3419077AF581C1B.description:
Acknowledge new information expressed by others
in a discussion and relate it to own ideas.

754D4E55398A4D00A301A85A135349C2.description:
Remain on the topic of the discussion when asking
or answering questions or making other
contributions to a discussion.

66DE54F62B7E4ABB813AC0F034A7A565.description:
Follow simple rules and carry out assigned roles
during discussions.

6798A046326540548C605DE376652362.description:
Come to discussions prepared to share information
previously studied.

81032D2CA48B43A29B7C3C1FDDE8BFFF.description:
Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

DC7E52FCEF01478693CC021E87DF8B36.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 8 Reading
Standards to informational texts (e.g., “Use
relevant and sufficient evidence for supporting the
claims and argument.”).

5760EE96A98341CA90A0C9D0460ABA0D.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 8 Reading
Standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and
contrast themes, patterns of events, or characters
across two or more stories or dramas.”).

5C48B33F643A4F9AB74399B4A18C3A88.description:
Use information from literary and informational
text to support writing

289B8F3889A74EBB9CEADA70CAE2FCD3.description:
Select quotes providing relevant information
about a topic from multiple print or digital sources.

D59EC0448B354B2E933586ED6BB1492D.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer and
pose questions based on one source of information.

319BF78AB78346A6BC50F78E5FABF401.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

12C12D90F5C14F66AB03E13A630A40D2.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to
produce writing to interact and collaborate with others.

CC134DA6860D40E9AE0F095772937715.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, plan before writing and revise own writing.

A8155C8B87BE4B6BB6D9DD83FD41593C.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate for the task,
purpose, or audience.

AB62C85939AB4E4FAEC7A1CA5626E682.description:
Use words that describe the feelings of characters
or provide other sensory information about the
setting, experiences, or events.

F09FDDE867EF4B328E76D1F36D29425F.description:
Use temporal words (e.g., first, then, next) to signal
order.

701E5BB1697048788B5CB1B576B7808A.description:
Write a narrative about a real or imagined
experience introducing the experience, at least one
character, and two or more events.

0BC2FE6CC4714A42A9E6DEA3516C8482.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

22CEAA183E6A47429898B72E15BB7FDF.description:
Use domain specific vocabulary related to the
topic.

87F6A84A9D18454E86E68CB0870C08C6.description:
Write one or more facts or details related to the
topic.

DF0C23EF80F24EA1AD24C780F553B2AB.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and write to convey ideas
and information about it including visual, tactual, or
multimedia information as appropriate.

BBEF6D92C7AF4D9A91158A70683100EB.description: Write to share information supported by details.

57208C9694BA4709A303B16EDB2C5801.description:
Write reasons to support a claim about a topic or
text.

823AFDBA0C544DE49DC07CB69D1B825B.description:
Introduce the claim and provide reasons or pieces
of evidence to support it.

4632F8398B48485E968418861974DAF1.description: Write claims about topics or texts.

1DBA0A05748E44A3878AC27F2538D7EE.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
reading or listening to literary nonfiction.

571B7002C90D48CEA84BFB7F21A1B1C1.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

B5B338CC78AB4496A44C401E28116377.description:
Identify where two different texts on the same
topic differ in their interpretation of the details.

888424D84C0C4A19A31364FA44FEE529.description:
Determine the argument made by an author in
an informational text.

33C6B05CDC09492DAD72304223EAA56F.description:
Determine whether a topic is best presented as
audio, video, multimedia, or text.

291629EFCA6F4952AB269675E4EB8055.description:
Determine an author’s purpose or point of view
and identify examples from text to that describe or support
it.

BDF8BB781D304EC287531713AFEBAA3A.description:
Locate the topic sentence and supporting details
in a paragraph.

F9A234A675CA46A1BD22A4991719554C.description:
Determine connotative meanings of words and
phrases in a text.

525569DDCEC54919B997E87C0FC3EEE5.description:
Recount events in the order they were presented
in the text.

092392285B324FAFBFCA14D2BC29EDBB.description:
Provide a summary of a familiar informational
text.

5BC753E7DD3A41168CBC19C21666749F.description:
Cite text to support inferences from informational
text.

331A2ED28AB54C90B640C1AC1A0B42FC.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
actively engaged in reading or listening to stories, dramas,
and poetry.

FA949C4BF1A74C3596349C99C46E028E.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

738C1528A85941F885DC3E1BE46B2769.description:
Compare and contrast themes, patterns of
events, or characters across two or more stories or dramas.

A0D871E955B8484998B7E324D3BC3853.description:
Compare and contrast a text version of a story,
drama, or poem with an audio, video, or live version of the
same text.

5D13373E87AE44089D7F7D256B9EC99D.description:
Determine the difference in the points of view of
a character and the audience or reader in a text with
suspense or humor.

D6CF30413E254BBBA15E07F0792FF7CF.description:
Compare and contrast the structure of two or
more texts.

D3E930EAF220459984E5BB14E730DEAD.description:
Determine connotative meanings of words and
phrases in a text.

102915DC8DA04D2CA03320ACA00162F8.description:
Identify which incidents in a story or drama lead
to subsequent action.

6C6CF6B707F24C2595F48CD225F5EC8D.description:
Recount an event related to the theme or central
idea, including details about character and setting.

C73EBBA1F81946958B5A79EBF3F0094C.description:
Cite text to support inferences from stories and
poems.
